bioghist.p: Vera Dreiser (1908-1998) was a psychologist and the niece of author Theodore Dreiser. Vera Dreiser had a clinical psychology practice, and from 1962 to 1966 she was staff psychologist of the California Institution for Women. In 1976 she co-authored, with Brett Howard, a book about her uncle entitled My Uncle Theodore.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Dreiser family papers and memorabilia and professional papers of Vera Dreiser. The bulk of the collection consists of papers relating to the literary estate of Theodore Dreiser. These include correspondence with publishers and agents related to contracts, royalties, and US and foreign literary rights; royalty statements and contracts. Also included is correspondence of Helen Dreiser and her sister Myrtle Butcher regarding the estate. There are also some records relating to rights to compositions by Theodore Dreiser's brother, the composer Paul Dresser. Family papers and ephemera include: letters to Vera Dreiser from Myrtle Butcher, Helen Dreiser, James T. Farrell, Shailer Lawton; and from other family members and friends; a scrapbook of clippings about Edward Dreiser; a baby book for Vera Dreiser and her daughter Sheri Dreiser Scott; a souvenir book of Paul Dresser's compositions (1895-1898); locks of hair from several members of the Dreiser family (including Vera, Helen, Mai, and Sheri); and two plaster busts of Theodore Dreiser. Vera Dreiser's professional papers include files related to Vera Dreiser's clinical psychology practice, patient files and appointment books (1956-1959).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
